title: Oppenheimer
description: The story of J. Robert Oppenheimer and the development of the atomic bomb.

title: Poor Things
description: A young woman brought back to life by an unorthodox scientist embarks on a journey of self-discovery and sexual liberation in this dark comedy based on Alasdair Gray's novel.

title: Killers Of The Flower Moon
description: Based on a true story, the film depicts the serial murder of members of the oil-wealthy Osage Nation in 1920s Oklahoma, a string of brutal crimes that came to be known as the Reign of Terror.

title: Barbie
description: Barbie and Ken are having the time of their lives in the colorful and seemingly perfect world of Barbie Land. However, when they get a chance to go to the real world, they soon discover the joys and perils of living among humans.

title: Maestro
description: A biopic of legendary composer Leonard Bernstein, focusing on his complex relationship with his wife Felicia Montealegre and his struggles with his sexuality.

title: American Fiction
description: A novelist who's fed up with the establishment profiting from "Black" entertainment uses a pen name to write a book that propels him to the heart of hypocrisy and the madness he claims to disdain.

title: Anatomy Of A Fall
description: A woman is suspected of murder after her husband's death; their half-blind son faces a moral dilemma as the main witness.

title: The Holdovers
description: A disliked professor at a prep school stays on campus during Christmas break to supervise students who couldn’t go home. He, a troubled student, and the school's head cook form an unlikely bond.

title: The Zone Of Interest
description: The film focuses on Auschwitz commandant Rudolf Höss and his wife Hedwig, as they strive to build an idyllic life for their family in a house and garden adjacent to the concentration camp.

title: Napoleon
description: The film explores the origins and rapid rise to power of French Emperor Napoleon Bonaparte. It highlights his military genius and ambitious nature, focusing particularly on his tumultuous and passionate relationship with his wife, Joséphine.

title: Past Lives
description: Follows two deeply connected childhood friends who are separated when one emigrates from South Korea. Reunited in New York two decades later, they confront destiny, love, and the choices that define their lives.

title: Nyad
description: Chronicles the true story of Diana Nyad, a long-distance swimmer who, at the age of 64, became the first person to swim from Cuba to Florida without a shark cage. Highlights her determination and the support of her best friend and coach, Bonnie Stoll.

title: Society Of The Snow
description: Recounts the true story of the 1972 Andes plane crash, focusing on the Uruguayan rugby team members who survived and had to endure extreme conditions to stay alive.

title: The Creator
description: Set in a dystopian future where humans are at war with AI, the story follows a former soldier who is recruited to hunt down and kill the Creator, the elusive architect of advanced AI, but discovers the weapon is a young child.

title: Mission: Impossible - Dead Reckoning Part One
description: Ethan Hunt and his IMF team must track down a dangerous weapon before it falls into the wrong hands, facing a rogue AI and various adversaries.

title: Rustin
description: A biographical film about Bayard Rustin, an influential civil rights leader and the organizer of the 1963 March on Washington.

title: The Color Purple
description: A musical adaptation of Alice Walker's novel about the life-long struggles of African American women in the early 20th century South.

title: May December
description: An actress travels to meet a woman she will portray in a film, delving into the complexities of her life and the scandal that defined it.

title: Golda
description: A dramatic portrayal of Israeli Prime Minister Golda Meir's leadership during the Yom Kippur War.

title: The After
description: N/A

title: Invincible
description: N/A

title: Knight of Fortune
description: The film tells the story of Karl, dealing with the loss of a loved one, grief, and a challenging situation with a coffin.

title: Red, White and Blue
description: A single mother travels with her daughter in search of an abortion in a restrictive legal environment.

title: The Wonderful Story of Henry Sugar
description: An adaptation of Roald Dahl's short story about a man who masters the art of seeing without using his eyes.

title: Letter to a Pig
description: A Holocaust survivor reads a letter to the pig that saved his life. A schoolgirl hears his testimony and embarks on a surreal journey exploring identity and collective trauma.

title: Ninety-Five Senses
description: A humorous exploration of the human senses narrated from the perspective of someone who experiences the world in a unique way.

title: Our Uniform
description: The story of a prestigious private school and the complexities of identity and conformity faced by its students.

title: Pachyderme
description: Follows the journey of an elephant in a wildlife sanctuary and the human connections formed through the preservation efforts.

title: War is Over!
description: Set in a post-war world, the film delves into the lives of survivors as they navigate rebuilding their lives and society.

title: Flamin’ Hot
description: The inspiring true story of Richard Montañez, a Frito Lay janitor who used his Mexican American heritage to create Flamin' Hot Cheetos and revolutionized the food industry.

title: American Symphony
description: A documentary that follows the lives of musicians and composers in the United States, exploring the diverse and dynamic landscape of American music.

title: Indiana Jones and the Dial of Destiny
description: Indiana Jones returns for another adventure, this time involving a mysterious artifact that holds the key to untold power and destiny.

title: Bobi Wine: The People’s President
description: A documentary about the Ugandan musician and politician Bobi Wine, chronicling his journey from the slums of Kampala to becoming a leading figure in the fight for democracy and justice in Uganda.

title: The Eternal Memory
description: A documentary that explores the life and memories of Chilean journalist Augusto Góngora as he battles Alzheimer's disease, reflecting on his life and the history of his country.

title: Four Daughters
description: A documentary exploring the story of Olfa Hamrouni and her daughters, blending interviews with reenactments to reveal the impact of radicalization on the family.

title: To Kill a Tiger
description: A powerful documentary following a father's relentless fight for justice for his teenage daughter after she is gang-raped in a small Indian village.

title: 20 Days in Mariupol
description: A harrowing documentary capturing the first 20 days of the Russian invasion of Ukraine, focusing on the siege of Mariupol and the impact on its residents.

title: The ABCs Of Book Banning
description: A documentary exploring the rising trend of book banning in the United States, examining the cultural and political forces driving this movement.

title: The Barber of Little Rock
description: Explores the racial wealth gap in America through the story of People Trust, a community bank in Little Rock, Arkansas, founded by Arlo Washington to uplift the community.

title: Island in Between
description: A documentary highlighting the environmental and cultural challenges faced by a small island community as they navigate climate change and modernization.

title: The Last Repair Shop
description: A heartwarming documentary that follows a group of elderly craftsmen who run a repair shop, showcasing their skills, stories, and the importance of preserving traditional craftsmanship.

title: Nǎi Nai and Wài Pó
description: A touching story about the bond between two grandmothers and their grandchild, exploring themes of family, tradition, and cultural heritage.

title: Io Capitano
description: The film follows the journey of two young boys from Senegal who embark on a perilous journey to Europe in search of a better life, facing numerous challenges along the way.

title: Perfect Days
description: Follows the life of Hirayama, a public toilet cleaner in Tokyo, who finds beauty in the mundane aspects of his daily routine and the people he encounters.

title: The Teachers’ Lounge
description: A young teacher in Germany navigates the complexities and challenges of the education system, exploring themes of bureaucracy and the impact on personal lives.

title: The Boy And The Heron
description: A young boy named Mahito embarks on a fantastical adventure in a world shared with a mysterious heron, uncovering truths about life and death.

title: Elemental
description: In a city where fire, water, land, and air residents live together, a fiery young woman and a go-with-the-flow guy discover something elemental: how much they have in common.

title: Nimona
description: A young shapeshifter named Nimona teams up with a knight to expose the truth behind the oppressive institution ruling their world.

title: Robot Dreams
description: An animated tragicomedy set in 1980s NYC, following the friendship between a dog and a robot, exploring themes of loneliness and companionship.

title: Spider-Man: Across The Spider-Verse
director: Joaquim Dos Santos, Kemp Powers, Justin K. Thompson
description: Miles Morales embarks on a new adventure across the multiverse, encountering different versions of Spider-Man and facing new threats.

title: Godzilla Minus One
description: Set in post-war Japan, Godzilla reemerges and brings further devastation to a nation already struggling to rebuild.

title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3
description: The Guardians embark on a mission to protect one of their own, facing new adversaries and confronting their pasts.

title: El Conde
description: A dark satire that imagines a world where Augusto Pinochet is a 250-year-old vampire ready to die, but the vultures around him won’t let him go so easily.
